Job Title: Purchasing Specialist

Location: Mason, OH

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Purchasing, Supply Chain

Description:
The Purchasing Specialist will provide administrative support to the Purchasing Manager and the Project Team. This role will be responsible to develop, implement, manage and report out Indirect Savings for the business unit eCommerce/Retail of Swisslog Americas. This role also includes the ownership of the supplier list, process and monitor the PM Authorization to Order Requests, Requests for Quotes as well as Purchase Orders and obtain information from potential suppliers, approval and forms to set up new suppliers.

Responsibilities

Draft correspondences and other formal documentsMaintain office supplies, both tracking supplies on hand and orderingPerform general administrative tasks as needed, including ordering business cards, copying, scanning, filing, editing, printing and binding documents, etc.Coordinate routine maintenance of copiers and printers. Including ordering supplies, placing services calls, replacing necessary ink cartridges Ship domestic and international materials and small packages using FedEx, UPS, DHL and Postal Services.Support the Executive Administrative Assistant in planning and scheduling appointments and events as needed. Support the Project Management Team as needed Process Requisitions and issue Purchase Orders in SAP.Monitor purchase orders and obtain order confirmation.Keep Project Folders up to date, upload necessary information in the folder.Keep Supplier List current and up to date.Assure that NDA’s with our vendors are in place and valid.Per Request, send out Welcome Packages to potential new vendors, obtain needed forms and signatures, and set up supplier in the system. Obtain Supplier Evaluation if needed.Compile the RFQ Package and send out to defined vendors that will participate in the RFQ ProcessMonitor RFQ’s and obtain quotes in a timely mannerCreate Spreadsheets and log data as needed.Obtain information internally and/or externally for Purchasing Manager as needed.Ensure that plans and strategies for cost and value are backed by appropriate practices and behaviors.Develop, implement and manage category-sourcing strategies.Work independently on projects given.Identify potential cost saving opportunities.Work within a cross-functional team on high pressure projectsResponsible to develop, implement, manage, and report out Indirect Savings.

Application Requirements

Bachelors or Associates Degree in BusinessFluent in English, any other major language is an advantageAt least 3 years of experience working in the purchasing department; ideally in an industrial environmentPrevious experience working with Project TeamsSAP experience.and advanced Excel knowledge is preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong attention to detailStrong organizational skillsAbility to do problem solvingAbility to prioritize and multitask effectively to meet deadlinesProficient in Microsoft Office applicationsAct with a sense of urgency and focus on results, not activity.

About Swisslog

Swisslog is shaping the #future of #intralogistics. As part of the KUKA Group, we are at the forefront of technology that is changing the world. Serving some of the biggest and most exciting brands across the globe, we're a team of 2,000 professionals and 50 nationalities, working together to transform intralogistics with smart minds and fresh perspectives. With our flexible, #robotic and #data-driven automated solutions, we are powering the supply chain and taking the industry forward. #JoinOurTeam and bring ideas to life!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
